New Records: Kiké Hernández tied Babe Ruth for postseason home runs with his 15th career postseason home run.
Max Muncy tied Corey Seager and Justin Turner for the most postseason home runs as a Dodger in franchise history with his 13th home run.
Key Match Events: Kiké Hernández hit a two-run home run in the sixth inning to extend the Dodgers' lead.
Shohei Ohtani hit a home run in the eighth inning.
Max Muncy hit a home run in the ninth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Mookie Betts expressed amazement at Hernández's performance.
Max Muncy praised Hernández's ability to perform in critical moments.
Austin Barnes highlighted Hernández's focus and ability to thrive in high-pressure situations.
Max Muncy reflected on the significance of tying the Dodgers' postseason home run record.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Wind conditions affected fly balls to left field, as noted by Pete Alonso and Francisco Lindor.
Reed Garrett had not given up a home run on a splitter all year until Hernández's home run.
